intro: Phoradendron mazatlanum, commonly known as the Mazatlán mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in its native habitat. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its smooth, glossy, evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species plays an important ecological role in its ecosystem by providing food for wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of forested areas.
